key.name: avoidforwardkeyevent
key.description: Use a workaround if the forward_key_event() function is broken. Enable this option only if absolutely necessary, it can also cause problems, especially when XIM is used.

key.name: arrowkeysreopenpreedit
key.description: Whether it is allowed to put a word back into a preedit when the cursor moves to the end or the beginning of a word. Enabling this option is useful to correct already committed words.

key.name: emojipredictions
key.description: Whether Unicode symbols and emoji should be included in the predictions. Emoji are pictographs like ‚ò∫‚ô®‚õµ‚Ä¶. Unicode symbols are other symbols like mathematical symbols (‚àÄ‚àë‚àØ‚Ä¶), arrows (‚Üê‚Üë‚Üî‚Ä¶), currency symbols (‚Ç¨‚Çπ‚Ç∫‚Ä¶), braille patterns (‚†•‚†©‚Ä¶), and many other symbols. These are technically not emoji but nevertheless useful symbols.

key.name: offtherecord
key.description: While ‚ÄúOff the record‚Äù mode is on, learning from user input is disabled. If learned user input is available, predictions are usually much better than predictions using only dictionaries. Therefore, one should use this option sparingly. Only if one wants to avoid saving secret user input to disk it might make sense to use this option temporarily.

key.name: emojitriggercharacters
key.description: The characters in this list trigger an emoji and Unicode symbol lookup even if the option ‚ÄúUnicode symbols and emoji predictions‚Äù is off.

key.name: autocommitcharacters
key.description: The characters in this list cause the preedit to be committed automatically, followed by a space. For example, if ‚Äú.‚Äù is an auto commit character, this saves you typing a space manually after the end of a sentence. You can freely edit this list, a reasonable value might be ‚Äú.,;:?!)‚Äù. You should not add characters to that list which are needed by your input method, for example if you use Latin-Pre (t-latn-pre) it would be a bad idea to add ‚Äú.‚Äù to that list because it would prevent you from typing ‚Äú.s‚Äù to get ‚Äú·π°‚Äù. You can also disable this feature completely by making the list empty (which is the default).

key.name: tabenable
key.description: If this option is on, suggestions are not shown by default. Typing Tab is then necessary to show the list of suggestions. After a commit the suggestions are hidden again until the next Tab key is typed.

key.name: rememberlastusedpreeditime
key.summary: Remember last used preedit input method
key.description: If more then one input method is used at the same time, one of them is used for the preedit. Which input method is used for the preedit can be changed via the menu or via shortcut keys. If this option is enabled, such a change is remembered even if the session is restarted.

key.name: inputmode
key.description: Whether ibus-typing-booster is on or off.

key.name: rememberinputmode
key.description: If this option is enabled, the last used input mode (on/off) is remembered even if the session is restarted.

key.name: disableinterminals
key.description: Whether ibus-typing-booster should be disabled in terminals.

key.name: asciidigits
key.description: Some input methods produce language specific digits by default. If one never wants to use such language specific digits but prefers western (ASCII) digits always, one can set this option to convert language specific digits produced by input methods always to ASCII digits.

key.name: addspaceoncommit
key.summary: Add a space when committing by label or mouse
key.description: Add a space if a candidate from the candidate list is committed using a key for the label in front of the candidate (I.e. the using the 1-9 or F1-F9) or by clicking on a candidate with the mouse.

key.name: inlinecompletion
key.description: Whether the best completion is first shown inline in the pre√´dit instead of showing a full candidate list. The inline candidate can be selected by typing Tab and then committed as usual, for example by typing Space or Control+Space. Typing Tab again moves to the next candidate and opens the full candidate list.

key.name: autocapitalize
key.description: Automatically capitalize after punctuation.

key.name: pagesize
key.description: How many suggestion candidates to show in one page of the candidate list.

key.name: lookuptableorientation
key.description: Whether the candidate window should be drawn horizontally or vertically.

key.name: preeditunderline
key.description: Which style of underlining to use for the preedit.

key.name: preeditstyleonlywhenlookup
key.summary: Use preedit style only if lookup is enabled
key.description: If this option is on, a preedit style like underlining will only be used if lookup is enabled. The lookup can be disabled because one uses the option to enable lookup only when a key is pressed or because one uses the option to require a minimum number of characters before a lookup is done.

key.name: mincharcomplete
key.summary: Minimum number of chars for completion
key.description: Show no suggestions when less than this number of characters have been typed.

key.name: debuglevel
key.description: When greater than 0, debug information may be printed to the log file and debug information may also be shown graphically.

key.name: shownumberofcandidates
key.description: Display how many candidates there are and which one is selected on top of the list of candidates.

key.name: showstatusinfoinaux
key.summary: Show status info in auxiliary text
key.description: Show in the auxiliary text whether ‚ÄúEmoji prediction‚Äù mode and ‚ÄúOff the record‚Äù mode are on or off and show which input method is currently used for the pre√´dit. The auxiliary text is an optional line of text displayed above the candidate list.

key.name: usedigitsasselectkeys
key.description: Use the regular digits 1-9 as select keys. If that option is on, numbers can only by typed while no suggestions are shown. Therefore, completions for numbers cannot be suggested. And typing words containing numbers, like ‚ÄúA4‚Äù is more difficult as typing ‚Äú4‚Äù would select the 4th suggestion. On the other hand, selecting suggestions using 1-9 is easier then using the always enabled select keys F1-F9 as the latter keys are farther away from the fingers.

key.name: autoselectcandidate
key.description: What you type will automatically be corrected to the best candidate by selecting the best candidate automatically. If this option is off you have to select a candidate manually by using the key binding to select the next candidate. If this option is on and you do not want to use the automatically selected candidate, you can use the key binding for the ‚Äúcancel‚Äù command which will deselect all candidates.

key.name: inputmethod

key.description: Comma separated list of m17n input methods to use.

key.name: inputmethodchangetimestamp
key.summary: Time when an input method last was changed
key.description: If that time stamp changes, reload all input methods.

key.name: dictionary
key.summary: A list of dictionaries to use
key.description: Comma separated list of dictionaries to use.

key.name: dictionaryinstalltimestamp
key.summary: Time when a dictionary last was installed
key.description: If that time stamp changes, reload all dictionaries.
